title: What is your favorite element?
content:
My favorite elements are Oxygen and Gold. What is your favorite element?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] (the choices are the most popular elements) (other is there just incase someone likes an element that isn't as popular as the four elements listed)Signed, Harvey Smith

title: Re: What is your favorite element?
content:
Because its dense and high melting and used in light bulbs.

I love vanadium. Anyone who's seen the vanadium rainbow will have to agree.

title: Re: What is your favorite element?
content:
I'd have to say...

Carbon; if it is alive, it is made of carbon.

title: Re: What is your favorite element?
content: I prefer the real elements; fire, water, air, earth and make gold of those. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: haha
content: Yeah, the Dungeons and Dragons nerd in me sprang to life, and I clicked on this thread eagerly anticipating choosing "Fire" over "Water," "Earth," and "Wind."  I'm a sucker for flames, the color red, and passionate tempers.  :-)

title: Re: What is your favorite element?
content: What about silicon?  It'd be pretty difficult to play Keen without it [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: What is your favorite element?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I prefer the real elements[hr][/quote]

How are those more real than the ones listed above?
There isn't much elemental about them.
Of course the use of the word for the list above isn't correct either we now know, just like the word "atom" was poorly chosen in hindsight.
Of course the so-called classical elements are more romantical in nature.

Anyway, I chose silver, for no good reason.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
